summary: The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) is a major public broadcaster in the UK, founded in 1922. It's known for its radio, TV, and online services, employing over 21,000 people. The BBC is funded by a TV license fee paid by British households. This fee supports various BBC services across the UK and the BBC World Service, which broadcasts globally in many languages. The BBC also makes money through its international program sales and news services. It has been an essential part of British culture, often called "Auntie" or "Beeb."
title: BBC
